text: Vonda Neel McIntyre (August 28, 1948 â€“ April 1, 2019) was an American author. She wrote science fiction. Her best known novels include Dreamsnake (1978), Barbary (1986) and The Moon and the Sun (1997). She also wrote many Star Trek novelizations. She won three Nebula Awards and a Hugo Award. Robert A. Heinlein's 1982 book Friday was in part dedicated to McIntyre. She was born in Louisville, Kentucky. McIntyre died of pancreatic cancer on April 1, 2019 in Seattle, Washington.
